sentence.Network_en: If these drugs are stopped abruptly then some withdrawal symptoms may occur.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果突然停服这些药，则可能出现一些戒断症状。

sentence.Network_en: Then abruptly he revved the engine to full power.
sentence.Network_cn: 然后他突然加速到最大马力。

sentence.Network_en: Isabel rose so abruptly that she knocked down her chair.
sentence.Network_cn: 伊莎贝尔起得太急了，以致碰倒了她坐的椅子。

list.abs: about20 Chinatown garment workers-who said their boss abruptly closed up shop , leaving them high and dry at Christmas-yesterday demanded $ 40 , 000 in back pay .大约20名唐人街制衣工人——他们说老板突然关闭工厂，令他们在圣诞节一筹莫展——昨天要求付给他们40000元欠薪。

entry.tran: 突然的，意外的（常指令人不快的改变或行为）
entry.def: An abrupt change or action is very sudden, often in a way which is unpleasant.

example.ex: Rosie's idyllic world came to an abrupt end when her parents' marriage broke up...
example.tran: 父母婚姻的破裂使得罗茜田园诗般美好的世界陡然画上了句号。

example.ex: The recession brought an abrupt halt to this happiness...
example.tran: 经济衰退让这幸福戛然而止。

entry.def: Someone who is abrupt speaks in a rather rude, unfriendly way.

example.ex: He was abrupt to the point of rudeness...
example.tran: 他的唐突已到了无礼的地步。

example.ex: Cross was a little taken aback by her abrupt manner.
example.tran: 她鲁莽的态度让克罗斯感到有点吃惊。

auth_sentence.content: Then she left abruptly after refusing to answer questions.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then she left abruptly after refusing to answer questions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then she left abruptly after refusing to answer questions.

auth_sentence.content: He abruptly ended his news conference, citing exhaustion.
auth_sentence.res_content: He abruptly ended his news conference, citing exhaustion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He abruptly ended his news conference, citing exhaustion.

auth_sentence.content: But Wednesday morning, he abruptly announced his resignation.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Wednesday morning, he abruptly announced his resignation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Wednesday morning, he abruptly announced his resignation.

sentences.en: I was abruptly notified that a half-hour speech was expected of me.
sentences.cn: 我突然被通知要讲半个小时的话。

sentences.en: When he could stand it no longer, he rose abruptly to his feet.
sentences.cn: 他再也忍不住了,忽然站起身来。

sentences.en: It had never occurred to her that a new possibility would crop up abruptly.
sentences.cn: 她万万没有想到会突然出现一种新的可能性。

sentences.en: The advantage abruptly turned against them.
sentences.cn: 有利的条件突然变得对他们不利起来。
他的合同意外地终止了。

sentences.en: He gestured abruptly for Virginia to get in the car.
sentences.cn: 他粗鲁地示意弗吉尼亚上车。

sentences.en: The ground falls away abruptly to the right.
The road ends abruptly in a drop to the sea.
sentences.cn: 道路的尽头是一个通向大海的陡坡。
